Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in requiring the applicant to seek state protection and whether it ignored evidence of inadequate state protection
Procedural_Context: Judicial review of a refugee claim decision
Evidence_Type: Evidence of effective legal remedies, Ombudsman's office addressing rights violations
Legal_Provision: IRPA - absence of state protection requirement
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution as a lesbian in Costa Rica
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Availability of state protection in Costa Rica
Regulation_Cited: IRPA sections related to refugee protection and state protection availability
Application_Error: Alleged failure to consider lack of state protection
Evidence_Ignored: Claimant's argument that state protection was ineffective
Legal_Standard: Demonstration of absence of state protection under IRPA
Application_Factor: Applicant did not seek state protection in Costa Rica
Decision_Review_Issue: Board's requirement to seek state protection and assessment of its adequacy
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA provisions on refugee eligibility and state protection
Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to demonstrate absence of state protection
Evidentiary_Issues: Board found evidence of functional legal remedies
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged reasonableness of Board's decision
Omission_Type: Failure to pursue available state protection
